text: If anyone out there is wondering how and why the Trump administration’s national security decision-making (i.e. North Korea sanctions) is so topsy-turvy, the roots of the dysfunction go back to before he even took office:
author: nahaltoosi

text: There’s certainly a lot of material to sort through, as I learned: https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2019/03/01/trump-national-security-council-225442 …
author: nahaltoosi

text: For more on this, read my story: https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2019/03/01/trump-national-security-council-225442 …

author: nahaltoosi

text: 8/In the wake of the New Zealand attacks, as well as criticism that the Trump administration is Islamophobic and supports white nationalists, it will be interesting to see what Veprek & Marocco say during the conference. (Though honestly I can’t tell if it will be made public.)
author: nahaltoosi

text: 7/The State Department told me Veprek & Marocco will speak on the panel “Security Challenges of Migration and the Importance of Borders” on March 24. It also said: “We are not able to comment on any of the views of the other presenters.”
author: nahaltoosi

text: 6/The rest of the speakers are listed here (I don’t recognize them all, but they seem super interesting): http://budapestsummit.mcc.hu/en?fbclid=IwAR0rVn3mi587uqLRAlptOBVEaIkP2NzIpqcuFdQaLE-iKrQsjq_IleMO29o#lecturers …
author: nahaltoosi

text: 5/The other is Kenneth Abramowitz, founder of “Save the West.” He has said: “We have to save western civilization, which includes America, Europe, and Israel from the existential threat posed by Iran, North Korea, and global Islamic Jihadism.”
author: nahaltoosi

text: 4/The speakers include at least 2 notable names. One is Ayaan Hirsi Ali, a feminist scholar whose views on Islam many Muslims consider deeply offensive, but whom many conservatives have embraced as a worthy voice against Islamist intolerance.
author: nahaltoosi

text: 3/The U.S. officials going are both deputy assistant secretaries: Andrew Veprek and Pete Marocco. Veprek has been in the news before:
author: nahaltoosi

text: 2/The “summit” will be held in Budapest, Hungary, a country whose increasingly autocratic government has adopted policies hostile to migrants. The event is hosted by an academic institution, but will include at least one Hungarian government official: http://budapestsummit.mcc.hu/en?fbclid=IwAR0rVn3mi587uqLRAlptOBVEaIkP2NzIpqcuFdQaLE-iKrQsjq_IleMO29o …
author: nahaltoosi

text: 1/A mini-SCOOP thread from me (Twitter only): The State Department is sending at least 2 people to a conference on migration later this week that will feature some rather controversial speakers.
author: nahaltoosi

text: Oscar. Obviously Oscar.

Dear PR People,
If I am asking the question again, it’s because your stupid set of talking points didn’t answer it the first time.
xoxo.

text: “You have poor and working-class black people who would like to get to better employment in another location, and a whole community collaborating to make this happen, and you have Duke with veto power.”

text: 3/It’s one of several times in recent weeks that Pompeo has suggested State Department employees are primarily coastal elites. The Washington Post checked out his claims and found them to be flawed:
author: nahaltoosi

text: 2/The interview was with Nick Gosnell of WIBW NewsDay Now. Pompeo is boasting about being back in Kansas, part of a domestic tour that’s raising all sorts of suspicions that he’s eyeing a run for the Senate or maybe president (eventually).
author: nahaltoosi

text: 1/In a new interview, @SecPompeo again makes this weird comment: “I don’t just want folks working here (State Dept) who come from Washington or Boston or New York.” It’s misleading, & I wonder if he knows how much his staffers are insulted, given they come from all over the US.
author: nahaltoosi

text: Maybe the colleges don’t want to be more affordable or more accessible because that would damage their “brand,” which is really what matters to them. They don’t want to be less elitist, because then they’d supposedly be less elite.
author: nahaltoosi

text: Who’s running the betting pool on how long before we’re back at the original 2,000?
author: nahaltoosi

text: Elite schools act like if they admit a few more low-income kids but still keep preferences for legacies/rich kids they should escape criticism. They will say it’s about money. Really? They can’t find a better funding style? Also, do Harvard, Yale & Princeton really need more $$$?
author: nahaltoosi

text: Columnists should have term limits.
author: nahaltoosi

text: I had a fabulous, classy black leather biker jacket in high school. My mother hated it and somehow got rid of it, to my eternal fury.

text: Are black biker jackets back in style? Cause I want one.
author: nahaltoosi

text: Striking how Republican statements on New Zealand tragedy don’t mention victims were Muslim. Reminds me of when GOPers didn’t point out that the club attacks in Orlando massacre was an LGBT venue. (And Dems avoided noting killer was driven by Islamist views.)
author: nahaltoosi

text: The top Democrats on the Senate and House foreign affairs committees are demanding — again, and in strong terms — that @SecPompeo & @StateDept hand over documents related to political appointees’ alleged attacks on career staffers. https://foreignaffairs.house.gov/_cache/files/a/f/af101dbe-1a9f-48e1-b45b-529ad719f84b/CD2EF928DFD650998BD823812EE69808.03.15.19-hfac-sfrc-letter-to-pompeo---prohibited-personnel-practices---with-attachments.pdf …
